item.title: Book Review: Concurrency in Go
item.description: I recently finished reading the book “Concurrency in Go” by Katherine Cox-Buday. It is a relatively short book. A focused read can finish it in a few days. The content is relatively basic, consisting of a mix of concurrency fundamentals and of specific patterns commonly found in Go concurrent code. Overall, for someone who is new to Go concurrent primitives, the book provides a good review. I learnt some new things from the books:
